category.name: Particle-Particle Interactions
category.component: Adds linear elastic contact interactions to the simulation.
Adds linear elastic bond interactions to the simulation.
Adds rotational bonded interactions including normal, shear, torsion and bending forces.
Adds non-rotational friction (a Coulomb frictional law with shear stiffness) to the simulation. Forces are applied at particle centres, not at the contact point.
Adds rotational friction (a Coulomb frictional law with shear stiffness) to the simulation. Forces are applied at the contact point which generates moments.

Creates an interaction exclusion. When a pair of particles come into contact, a decision is made as to the types of interactions to which the pair is subjected. An exclusion precludes a pair of particles from being subjected to one interaction if they are already subjected to a second interaction. This is necessary, for example, in fracture models, where particles are initially elastically bonded, but after fracture occurs particles are subjected to a frictional type of interaction.
